entry.title: Tense Standoff Ends in Peaceful Arrests; Charges Dropped for Domestic Assault
entry.summary: A tense standoff in Douglas County ended peacefully with the arrest of a man and woman after a domestic dispute. Initial assault charges were dropped, with the man facing a felony weapons charge. The case remains under review.

entry.summary: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop

entry.title: ROSEBURG HAS RECORD BREAKING HIGH FOR THE DATE THURSDAY
entry.summary: February 28, 2025 4:10 a.m. It was a record-breaking high temperature for the date in the Umpqua Valley on Thursday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the mercury reached 70 degrees at the Roseburg Regional Airport. The previous record high for February 27th was 69 degrees,...

entry.title: EAGLE POINT MAN DIES IN EARLY MORNING TWO-VEHICLE CRASH
entry.summary: February 28, 2025 4:00 a.m. An Eagle Point man died in an early morning two-vehicle crash on Wednesday. An Oregon State Police report said just before 5:00 a.m. the accident was reported on Highway 138W near milepost 6 in the Kellogg area. The preliminary investigation indicated that an eastbound sedan, operated by 38-year-old Carl Gregory...

entry.title: POULENC TRIO CONCERT HAPPENING SATURDAY
entry.summary: February 28, 2025 3:50 a.m. In the KQEN Cultural Spotlight: The Umpqua Symphony Association is presenting The Poulenc Trio in concert this Saturday at 3:00 p.m. The event will be held at The Chapel at 2837 West Harvard Avenue. entry.title: HOME AND GARDEN SHOW HAPPENING FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY
entry.summary: February 28, 2024 3:40 a.m. The Umpqua Valley Home Builders Association Home and Garden Show is happening Friday through Sunday at the Douglas County Fairgrounds. entry.title: BOARD EXTENDS SUPERINTENDENT’S CONTRACT, APPLAUDS COMMITTMENT
entry.summary: February 28, 2025 3:30 a.m. On Wednesday, the Roseburg School Board voted to extend Superintendent Jared Cordon’s contract through June 30, 2028, citing his steadfast leadership and long-term vision for student success. A district release said the extension, which takes effect July 1st, reflects the board’s confidence in Cordon’s ability to continue driving meaningful advancements...

entry.title: REPRESENTATIVE OSBORNE MAKES STATEMENT ON OFF-ROAD VEHICLE BILL
entry.summary: February 28, 2025 3:20 a.m. On Thursday, the Oregon House of Representatives unanimously passed HB 2232A, a bill that changes the authority of creating off-road vehicle standards from the Director of Transportation and Environmental Quality Commission to the State Parks and Recreation Department. entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 2.27.25
entry.summary: Adapt Integrated Health Care staff member Josh Vernon tells his story of strength and recovery from long-term drug use and homelessness, and talks about the path he is on now, as he celebrates two years of sobriety today.
